Instruction: In a large bowl, mix together the flour, baking powder, and salt. Add the milk and blend well. Gradually pour in warm water while kneading the dough until it becomes soft but not sticky. Cover with plastic wrap and allow the dough to rest for approximately 15 minutes.
Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add enough oil to cover the bottom of the skillet. Cook the dough rounds in hot oil until golden brown, about 2 minutes per side.
Mix sugar and cinnamon together in a small bowl; sprinkle over warm doughnuts.
Feel free to substitute lard for shortening if preferred.

We have assessed the nutritional value of frying oil based on a retention value of 10% after cooking. The actual amount may vary depending on cooking time and temperature, ingredient density, and the specific type of oil used.
